intro: Ornithopodium perpusillum, commonly known as the dwarf bird's-foot, is a small, herbaceous plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant has a distinctive appearance with its tiny, clustered flowers and feathery leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rock crevices. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
